text: [music playing]

JACQUELINE HOWARD:
The best way to ward

off a hangover is not to drink
at all or drink in moderation.

But if you're going to drink,
here's something to consider.

Turns out dark liquors
like whiskey, darker beer,

and red wine have
more of the chemicals

that make your head
hurt and stomach
ache when you overdo it.

White or colored
or clear drinks,

like white wine and vodka,
have less of these compounds.

If you're going to
knock back a few,

make sure your next meal
is high in potassium,
vitamin A, and B vitamins.

Heavy drinking is linked to
a drop in those nutrients.

Try whipping up a
banana cantaloupe

smoothie or avocado
toast for a quick
potassium-powered breakfast.

For lunch or dinner,
try grilled chicken
with asparagus for B vitamins.

Complete the meal with
sweet potato wedges
for a good source of vitamin A.
[music playing]
[sound effects playing]
